definition.para: Date of creation of the original resource.

instructions.para: Express all dates, including date ranges, using Library of Congress' Extended Date Time Format.
Most recent version of EDTF available at https://www.loc.gov/standards/datetime/.
Date-Edtf value should agree with dates values entered in Date and Dates fields.

customization.para: Enter the date of the execution of the drawing.

example.para: If the Date field = "1940" then Date EDTF = "1940"
If the Date field = "1910?" then Date EDTF = "1910?"
If Date field = "May 9, 2001" then Date EDTF = "2001-05-09"
If Date field = "January 2008" then Date EDTF = "2008-01"
If Date field = "between 1930 and 1939" then Date EDTF = "1930/1939"
If Date field = "between 1855 and 1999?" then Date EDTF can be one of several options including "1855?/1999?"
If Date field = "before 2007" then Date EDTF is either "/2007" or "../2007"
If Date field = "after 2001" then Date EDTF is either "2001/" or "2001/.."

admin.para: This document needs a reference to the final spec.

For the xsd, datatype is xs:string; the datatype is more accurately http://id.loc.gov/datatypes/edtf, which is not a valid QName and is inavlid according to schema-4-properties, but this does not seem to be machine-actionable; more exploration needed.

generalNotes.para: EDTF is still a standard in progress. It has not yet been accpted as a full recommendation. It should be voted on in 2018 by ISO. We are anticipating it will becoming a 2-part ISO 8601-2018.

history.justification: Wanted to add standardized date forms (EDTF) required by Orbis Cascade Dublin Core Best Practices (https://www.orbiscascade.org/dublin-core-best-practices).
